alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 10:09AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wake and east central Chatham Counties through 1100 AM EDT... At 1009 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Cary, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Apex, Holly Springs, Knightdale, Crosswinds Campground, Lake Wheeler and New Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
